sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: localization-config is a package aimed to pre-configure language/country-related settings in various Debian packages, depending on the locale settings of the installed system.
When used while running &d-i; to install a new system, localization-config is called during the base-config run after rebooting the system and before installing packages.
Various parameters are set by this package for each language/country combination. As the package maintainer cannot set these parameters by him/herself, translators can help him/her to fine tune them.

sect2.title: X-Window keyboard settings
sect2.para: localization-config maps the console keyboard setting to X-Window (either XFree86 server or X.Org server) keyboard settings.

As a consequence, users who want to add the support for their language in localization-config should give information about the needed keyboard settings for X-Window. This is only needed for not already supported keyboard maps.
localization-config maintainer can add more information here

sect1.title: Sending the needed information
sect1.para: The needed information should be sent as a bug report (severity normal against the localization-config package.
For more information, translators should contact the package maintainer(s) at localization-config@packages.debian.org
